Package library

Class Customer

java.lang.Object
library.Customer
public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
Represents a customer of a library system.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Customer​(int idNumber, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.util.Date birthDate)
    Constructs a new Customer object with the specified ID number, first name, last name, and birth date.
    Customer​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.util.Date birthDate)
    Constructs a new Customer object with the specified first name, last name, and birth date.

  • Constructor Details

    • Customer

      public Customer​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.util.Date birthDate) throws org.json.JSONException, java.io.IOException, java.text.ParseException
      Constructs a new Customer object with the specified first name, last name, and birth date. The customer's ID number is automatically assigned.
      Parameters:
      firstName - the first name of the customer
      lastName - the last name of the customer
      birthDate - the birth date of the customer
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if there is an error parsing the JSON data
      java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading the file
      java.text.ParseException - if there is an error parsing the date

    • Customer

      public Customer​(int idNumber, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.util.Date birthDate) throws org.json.JSONException, java.io.IOException, java.text.ParseException
      Constructs a new Customer object with the specified ID number, first name, last name, and birth date.
      Parameters:
      idNumber - the unique identifier of the customer
      firstName - the first name of the customer
      lastName - the last name of the customer
      birthDate - the birth date of the customer
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if there is an error parsing the JSON data
      java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading the file
      java.text.ParseException - if there is an error parsing the date

      public boolean addLoan​(Loan newLoan)
      Adds a new loan to the customer's list of loans.
      Parameters:
      newLoan - the new loan to be added
      Returns:
      true if the loan was added successfully, false otherwise

    • removeLoan

      public void removeLoan​(Loan newLoan) throws LoanNotFoundException
      Removes a loan from the customer's list of loans.
      Parameters:
      newLoan - the loan to be removed
      Throws:
      LoanNotFoundException - if the loan is not found in the customer's list of loans

    • canBorrow

      public boolean canBorrow()
      Checks if the customer can borrow a new book based on the number of books currently borrowed.
      Returns:
      true if the customer can borrow a new book, false otherwise
